explanation:
To get $x^3$ and $\frac{1}{x^3}$, we cube $x+\frac{1}{x}$: $$-125=(-5)^3=\left(x+\frac{1}{x}\right)^3=x^3+3x+\frac{3}{x}+\frac{1}{x^3}$$ by the Binomial Theorem. Conveniently, we can evaluate $3x +
\frac{3}{x}$ as  $3\left(x+\frac{1}{x}\right)=3(-5)=-15$, so $$x^3+\frac{1}{x^3}=(-125)-(-15)=\boxed{-110}.$$
